messages: 940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (19:05): ok, going to the office now
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (19:13): MarcoZ: who originally created markup.js (for our name testing)
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (19:17): davidb: I believe it was surkov during our "wild" times in later 2008.
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (19:17): davidb: We were looking for an efficient way to test the different name markup structures.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (19:21): on one hand i like it, and on the other i think it makes things less transparent.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (19:21): but mostly i think we could do more of this kind of thing
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (19:22): davidb: The alternative would have been to create the same piece of element over and over, just taking away or adding a supported attribute at a time.
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (19:23): davidb: This just automates this by creating the element with the different pieces puzzled together, taking away the attributes in a specific order.
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (19:24): Looks like Mark's patch didn't burn the tree. It built fine on my system, too.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (19:25): good good
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (19:46): hi eeejay
adac12ae66614ea0881c443777882c0a (19:51): <-- running to find coffee
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (19:52): you're in seattle, how hard can it be?
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (19:52): as hard as in Vancouver I guess ;-)
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (19:52): where Starbucks coverage is better than the cellphones
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (19:53): a Tim Hortons opened near the office. it is already packed
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (19:53): i can't fall down with out hitting a coffee shop
adac12ae66614ea0881c443777882c0a (20:17): surprisingly our china town has very little coffee options
adac12ae66614ea0881c443777882c0a (20:17): decent coffee is a 7 minute walk away (i know!)
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (20:18): eeejay: time to buy supplied to make coffee ;-)
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (20:18): espresso machine, aeropress, you name it
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:24): eeejay: if there is a vietnamese place hiding in china town that can be decent for coffee
adac12ae66614ea0881c443777882c0a (20:25): davidb, true, french colonial style :)
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (20:48): Oops I think I did it again. Wrote a blog post that turned out waaaay longer than I originally thought. But I must admit it's one of my better ones. ;)
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:52): MarcoZ: typo jumped out at me "funny discoaimer"
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (20:58): davidb: Ah, thanks!

3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (21:00): And now I'm off for the night. See you all tomorrow!

906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:10): askalski: apparently Mozilla has donated to http://nowoczesnapolska.org.pl/
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:12): davidb, nice. they actively oppose ACTA, but I guess Polish hackers taking down .gov sites are more visible medially :)
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:13): davidb, they do "open books" initiative, that's good

22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:14): my previous employer is an entropenour in education business, I tried to convince him to donate some of his databases to public domain as a freemium advertising (to raise popularity of his page for example). I must have been not enough convincing :(
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:14): yeah, open books are really the future
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:15): davidb, did you know, that Polish constitution guarantees free access to all levels of public education for free on fair recruitment process?
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:15): amazing
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:16): true. I haven't paid for my studies. I have no loan. That's great.

22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:16): only books are sold commercially, so there is a strong public movement of creating "open books", so anyone can download them and print, or read on Kindle or anything, to keep the price low
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:17): unfortunately, government is not very supportive with that, these are public initiatives
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:18): our local university is surrounded by photocopying places.
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:18): both the organization you donated, and me to some extent are members of this bottom up movement :)
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:18): seems very "Mozilla"
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:35): davidb, got a minute? I have a question to a bug

47e87577fff6e08b0f2f43540db8c9c9 (21:35): Bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=706134 nor, --, ---, askalski, NEW, ARIA listitem shouldn't expose selectable state and pick up aria-selected and aria-checked
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:35): I removed http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/accessible/src/base/nsARIAMap.cpp#260 and 261
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:36): so now it has no nsARIA records at all
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:36): I understand that it does follow http://www.w3.org/TR/2010/WD-wai-aria-20100916/roles#listitem
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:36): ok looking now
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:36): but now making the tests to work means removing pretty much all interaction with listitem
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:36): everywhere
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:37): well try to be surgical if you can
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:37): for example
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:37): in test_aria_token_attrs.html

22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:38): it's all about checking whether listitems are checkable. I removed all tests. Tried to think about any (like readonly or something), but I was not sure what HTML to create for that
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:38): more importantly
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:39): or, maybe skype and I'll show you my desktop
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:39): or I'll just propose the patch
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:39): and we'll discuss it later
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:40): the patch way is preferred
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:47): askalski: testStates() allows you to specify states that should not be present
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:47): read the functions definition in states.js
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:48): tbsaunde, thanks! it's certainly better than ripping things off. can you tell me now how to revert a single file with HG :D?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:50): askalski: hg revert --all
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:50): tbsaunde, single file?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:50): err, not --all of course
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:52): probably revert -f fname
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:52): not sture
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:53): askalski: that's what hg help revert is for ;)
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:53): tbsaunde, I see. thanks, back in modding tests :)
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:54): because the people who wrote mercurial wheren't content with there other silliness and decided manpages just wheren't good enough for them :p
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:54): tbsaunde, something more
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:54): is there a way
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:54): a single test
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:54): not all of them?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:56): TEST_PATH=accessible/test_foo.html make -C objdir mochitest-a11y
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:56): or --test-path to runtests.py if that how you like to do things

22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (21:59): tbsaunde, ok. if the listbox is multi-selectable, but it's children (listitems) are not checkable in nsARIAmap.cpp, should I expect them to be checkable (in tests) or not?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (22:00): askalski: selectable and checkable are different states and not related
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (22:01): so there is no reason to believe the items are  because the list is multiselectable
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (22:04): tbsaunde, so I should just change these tests in order to assure that items are not selectable, right?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (22:05): askalski: well, ensure they aren't whatever we think they should be now but you changed
